conclusion: Determine the initial height h for the ball to barely pass point E
At point E, the centripetal force must be provided by gravity, leading to v_E = 1.4 m/s
Using conservation of energy from point B to point E, v_B^2 = 9.8, leading to v_B = 3.13 m/s
Determine the velocity at point B after the collision
Using conservation of energy for the slider from point P to point A, v_A^2 = 7.84, leading to v_A = 2.8 m/s for h = 0.45 m
After the elastic collision with the ball at rest, the velocity of the ball is v_B = v_A = 3.13 m/s
Determine the horizontal distance x after the collision with G
The time to fall from point F to the ground is t = 0.35 s
The horizontal distance x is x = v_B * t = 1.10 m
